name: Paris

Rogier van der Weyden - The Descent from the Cross
René Magritte - The Son of Man

name: Zurich
cuisine: Zürcher Geschnetzeltes (veal in creamy sauce with rösti)
wikipediaSummary: Zurich is a historic city in Switzerland, known for its rich culture, beautiful architecture, and vibrant local traditions. The city has played an important role in the region's history and continues to be a center of commerce, education, and tourism.
weirdFacts: It has a law requiring residents to own a bomb shelter or access to one.
The city’s river is so clean that locals swim in it during summer.
A statue of a police officer once had to be removed because pigeons kept perching on his hat.

name: Budapest
wikipediaSummary: Budapest is a historic city in Hungary, known for its rich culture, beautiful architecture, and vibrant local traditions. The city has played an important role in the region's history and continues to be a center of commerce, education, and tourism.
art: Mihály Munkácsy - The Last Day of a Condemned Man

name: Bucharest
cuisine: Sarmale (cabbage rolls stuffed with meat and rice)
wikipediaSummary: Bucharest is a historic city in Romania, known for its rich culture, beautiful architecture, and vibrant local traditions. The city has played an important role in the region's history and continues to be a center of commerce, education, and tourism.
weirdFacts: It has the second-largest administrative building in the world after the Pentagon.
Its nickname was once 'Little Paris' due to French-style architecture and lifestyle.
The city’s underground network includes unused metro stations known as 'ghost stations.'

name: Sofia
wikipediaSummary: Sofia is a historic city in Bulgaria, known for its rich culture, beautiful architecture, and vibrant local traditions. The city has played an important role in the region's history and continues to be a center of commerce, education, and tourism.
weirdFacts: The city sits atop thousands of years of history, with Roman ruins integrated into the metro.
Its mineral springs have been used since antiquity for healing purposes.
A Soviet monument was once repainted by artists to show superheroes instead of soldiers.

name: Zagreb
cuisine: Purica s mlincima (roast turkey with flatbread)
wikipediaSummary: Zagreb is a historic city in Croatia, known for its rich culture, beautiful architecture, and vibrant local traditions. The city has played an important role in the region's history and continues to be a center of commerce, education, and tourism.
weirdFacts: It has a museum dedicated entirely to failed relationships, the Museum of Broken Relationships.
A cannon is fired daily at noon from a tower in the old town.
Its street lamps were among the last in Europe to be lit by gas and are still hand-lit today.

name: Ljubljana
wikipediaSummary: Ljubljana is a historic city in Slovenia, known for its rich culture, beautiful architecture, and vibrant local traditions. The city has played an important role in the region's history and continues to be a center of commerce, education, and tourism.
weirdFacts: A dragon is the symbol of the city, featured on its bridge and coat of arms.
It has one of the world’s oldest philharmonic orchestras, founded in 1701.
Underground caves nearby are inhabited by an unusual creature called the olm, also known as the 'baby dragon.'

name: Bratislava
cuisine: Bryndzové halušky (potato dumplings with sheep cheese and bacon)
wikipediaSummary: Bratislava is a historic city in Slovakia, known for its rich culture, beautiful architecture, and vibrant local traditions. The city has played an important role in the region's history and continues to be a center of commerce, education, and tourism.
weirdFacts: It is the only capital in the world bordering two independent countries.
The UFO-shaped restaurant on its bridge is a major landmark.
It has a statue of a sewer worker peeking out from a manhole that is a popular tourist attraction.

name: Vilnius
cuisine: Kibinai (pastries filled with meat or vegetables)
wikipediaSummary: Vilnius is a historic city in Lithuania, known for its rich culture, beautiful architecture, and vibrant local traditions. The city has played an important role in the region's history and continues to be a center of commerce, education, and tourism.
weirdFacts: Its old town is one of the largest surviving medieval old towns in Europe.
The city declared a whimsical 'Republic of Užupis' with its own constitution and president.
Hot air balloons often launch directly from the city center.

name: Riga
cuisine: Grey peas with bacon (Pelēkie zirņi ar speķi)
wikipediaSummary: Riga is a historic city in Latvia, known for its rich culture, beautiful architecture, and vibrant local traditions. The city has played an important role in the region's history and continues to be a center of commerce, education, and tourism.
weirdFacts: It has the largest collection of Art Nouveau architecture in Europe.
Its central market is housed in old Zeppelin hangars.
A local tradition is drinking rye bread kvass, a slightly fermented beverage.

name: Tallinn
wikipediaSummary: Tallinn is a historic city in Estonia, known for its rich culture, beautiful architecture, and vibrant local traditions. The city has played an important role in the region's history and continues to be a center of commerce, education, and tourism.
weirdFacts: Its old town is one of the best-preserved medieval city centers in Europe.
It was the first place in the world to hold an online political election.
The city hosts a massive song festival with tens of thousands of participants singing together.

name: Dublin
wikipediaSummary: Dublin is a historic city in Ireland, known for its rich culture, beautiful architecture, and vibrant local traditions. The city has played an important role in the region's history and continues to be a center of commerce, education, and tourism.

name: Lisbon
cuisine: Bacalhau à Brás (codfish with eggs and potatoes)
wikipediaSummary: Lisbon is a historic city in Portugal, known for its rich culture, beautiful architecture, and vibrant local traditions. The city has played an important role in the region's history and continues to be a center of commerce, education, and tourism.
weirdFacts: It predates Rome, with archaeological evidence of settlement over 3,000 years ago.
It suffered one of the deadliest earthquakes in history in 1755, followed by a tsunami and fires.
Its iconic yellow trams have been in operation since the 19th century.

name: Athens
wikipediaSummary: Athens is a historic city in Greece, known for its rich culture, beautiful architecture, and vibrant local traditions. The city has played an important role in the region's history and continues to be a center of commerce, education, and tourism.
art: Domenikos Theotokopoulos (El Greco) - View of Toledo

name: Nicosia
wikipediaSummary: Nicosia is a historic city in Cyprus, known for its rich culture, beautiful architecture, and vibrant local traditions. The city has played an important role in the region's history and continues to be a center of commerce, education, and tourism.
weirdFacts: It is the only divided capital city in the world, split by a UN buffer zone.
The walls surrounding the old town are shaped like a star from above.
It has been continuously inhabited for over 4,000 years.

name: Valletta
wikipediaSummary: Valletta is a historic city in Malta, known for its rich culture, beautiful architecture, and vibrant local traditions. The city has played an important role in the region's history and continues to be a center of commerce, education, and tourism.
weirdFacts: It was built almost entirely by the Knights of St. John after the Great Siege of 1565.
The city has over 300 monuments in a very compact area, making it an open-air museum.
Its streets were designed in a grid to let sea breezes cool the city.

name: Luxembourg
cuisine: Judd mat Gaardebounen (smoked pork with broad beans)
wikipediaSummary: Luxembourg is a historic city in Luxembourg, known for its rich culture, beautiful architecture, and vibrant local traditions. The city has played an important role in the region's history and continues to be a center of commerce, education, and tourism.
weirdFacts: The old city fortifications were so strong that the city was nicknamed the 'Gibraltar of the North.'
It is one of the few capitals where the monarch’s palace is right in the center of town and open to the public at times.
The city operates a fully free public transport system.

name: Monaco
cuisine: Barbajuan (stuffed pastry with chard and ricotta)
wikipediaSummary: Monaco is a historic city in Monaco, known for its rich culture, beautiful architecture, and vibrant local traditions. The city has played an important role in the region's history and continues to be a center of commerce, education, and tourism.
art: Claude Monet - Monte Carlo Viewed from Cap Martin
weirdFacts: It is smaller than New York’s Central Park yet remains a sovereign nation.
Its famous casino once banned citizens of the country from gambling there.
Formula 1 cars race through its regular city streets during the Grand Prix.

name: San Marino
cuisine: Torta Tre Monti (layered wafer cake with chocolate and hazelnut cream)
Passatelli (breadcrumbs, egg, and cheese pasta in broth)
Nidi di rondine (baked pasta rolls with cheese and ham)
wikipediaSummary: San Marino is a historic city in San Marino, known for its rich culture, beautiful architecture, and vibrant local traditions. The city has played an important role in the region's history and continues to be a center of commerce, education, and tourism.
weirdFacts: It claims to be the world’s oldest surviving republic, founded in 301 AD.
Its guards still wear colorful Renaissance-style uniforms.
The Three Towers on its mountain are featured on its national flag and coat of arms.

name: Vatican City
cuisine: Fettuccine Alfredo (Italian pasta from Rome area)
Saltimbocca alla Romana (veal with prosciutto and sage)
wikipediaSummary: Vatican City is a historic city in Vatican City, known for its rich culture, beautiful architecture, and vibrant local traditions. The city has played an important role in the region's history and continues to be a center of commerce, education, and tourism.
art: Raphael - The School of Athens
Michelangelo - The Last Judgment
weirdFacts: It is the smallest independent state in the world by area and population.
It has its own postal service, often faster than Italy’s.
The official ATM machines here offer Latin as a language option.

name: Andorra la Vella
cuisine: Escudella i carn d’olla (meat and vegetable stew)
Trinxat (cabbage and potato dish with pork)
wikipediaSummary: Andorra la Vella is a historic city in Andorra, known for its rich culture, beautiful architecture, and vibrant local traditions. The city has played an important role in the region's history and continues to be a center of commerce, education, and tourism.
weirdFacts: This country has no airports or train stations; you can only reach it by road from Spain or France.
Its parliament, the General Council, was founded in 1419, making it one of the oldest in Europe.
It has more tourists annually than permanent residents, by a factor of about 25.

name: Liechtenstein
wikipediaSummary: Liechtenstein is a historic city in Liechtenstein, known for its rich culture, beautiful architecture, and vibrant local traditions. The city has played an important role in the region's history and continues to be a center of commerce, education, and tourism.

name: Iceland
cuisine: Skyr (thick dairy product similar to yogurt)
wikipediaSummary: Iceland is a historic city in Iceland, known for its rich culture, beautiful architecture, and vibrant local traditions. The city has played an important role in the region's history and continues to be a center of commerce, education, and tourism.
art: Jóhannes Sveinsson Kjarval - Mount Esja

name: Moscow
wikipediaSummary: Moscow is a historic city in Russia, known for its rich culture, beautiful architecture, and vibrant local traditions. The city has played an important role in the region's history and continues to be a center of commerce, education, and tourism.
art: Wassily Kandinsky - Composition VII
Marc Chagall - Over the Town
weirdFacts: Its metro stations are decorated like palaces with chandeliers and mosaics.
The city has a museum dedicated entirely to vodka.
The Kremlin’s walls contain a secret cat colony cared for by staff.

name: Saint Petersburg
landmarks: Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood
wikipediaSummary: Saint Petersburg is a historic city in Russia, known for its rich culture, beautiful architecture, and vibrant local traditions. The city has played an important role in the region's history and continues to be a center of commerce, education, and tourism.
art: Ilya Repin - Barge Haulers on the Volga
Ivan Shishkin - Morning in a Pine Forest
Kazimir Malevich - Black Square
weirdFacts: It was founded by a czar who wanted a 'window to Europe' on the Baltic Sea.
The city is crisscrossed by canals, earning it the nickname 'Venice of the North.'
During World War II, it endured one of the longest sieges in history, lasting 872 days.

name: Kiev
wikipediaSummary: Kiev is a historic city in Ukraine, known for its rich culture, beautiful architecture, and vibrant local traditions. The city has played an important role in the region's history and continues to be a center of commerce, education, and tourism.
art: Taras Shevchenko - Dnipro Landscape
weirdFacts: Its cave monastery complex has mummified monks preserved for centuries.
A giant Motherland statue here is taller than the Statue of Liberty.
It claims one of the world’s deepest metro stations, more than 100 meters underground.

name: Minsk
wikipediaSummary: Minsk is a historic city in Belarus, known for its rich culture, beautiful architecture, and vibrant local traditions. The city has played an important role in the region's history and continues to be a center of commerce, education, and tourism.
art: Marc Chagall - Over Vitebsk
weirdFacts: It was almost entirely rebuilt after being destroyed during World War II.
Wide boulevards and monumental Soviet architecture dominate its center.
It has a large island memorial dedicated to soldiers lost in the Afghanistan war.

name: Chisinau
cuisine: Mămăligă (cornmeal porridge with cheese and sour cream)
wikipediaSummary: Chisinau is a historic city in Moldova, known for its rich culture, beautiful architecture, and vibrant local traditions. The city has played an important role in the region's history and continues to be a center of commerce, education, and tourism.
weirdFacts: It was almost completely destroyed in World War II and rebuilt in a Soviet style.
The city has more than 20 lakes, many formed by damming small rivers.
It is one of the greenest capitals in Europe, with large parts covered in parks and vineyards.

name: Tbilisi
wikipediaSummary: Tbilisi is a historic city in Georgia, known for its rich culture, beautiful architecture, and vibrant local traditions. The city has played an important role in the region's history and continues to be a center of commerce, education, and tourism.
art: Niko Pirosmani - Feast of the Kings
weirdFacts: Its name means 'warm place,' referring to the natural hot springs in the area.
Colorful wooden balconies are a hallmark of its traditional architecture.
Legend says it was founded after a king’s falcon fell into a hot spring.

name: Yerevan
wikipediaSummary: Yerevan is a historic city in Armenia, known for its rich culture, beautiful architecture, and vibrant local traditions. The city has played an important role in the region's history and continues to be a center of commerce, education, and tourism.
art: Martiros Saryan - Mount Ararat
Arshile Gorky - The Liver is the Cock’s Comb
weirdFacts: It is one of the world’s oldest continuously inhabited cities, founded in 782 BC.
The city’s main building stone is pink tuff, giving it the nickname 'The Pink City.'
It has giant stairway complex called the Cascade, adorned with modern art.

name: Baku
cuisine: Plov (saffron rice pilaf with meat and dried fruits)
wikipediaSummary: Baku is a historic city in Azerbaijan, known for its rich culture, beautiful architecture, and vibrant local traditions. The city has played an important role in the region's history and continues to be a center of commerce, education, and tourism.
weirdFacts: It lies below sea level, making it the lowest-lying national capital in the world.
Oil wells here have been operating since the 19th century, with some of the earliest commercial drilling in history.
Its Flame Towers are lit with LED screens to resemble flickering fire at night.

name: Ankara
wikipediaSummary: Ankara is a historic city in Turkey, known for its rich culture, beautiful architecture, and vibrant local traditions. The city has played an important role in the region's history and continues to be a center of commerce, education, and tourism.
weirdFacts: It became the capital in 1923, chosen for its central location rather than historical prominence.
The city is famous for a breed of long-haired goat producing mohair wool.
Ancient Roman baths and a temple dedicated to Augustus still stand here.

name: Istanbul
wikipediaSummary: Istanbul is a historic city in Turkey, known for its rich culture, beautiful architecture, and vibrant local traditions. The city has played an important role in the region's history and continues to be a center of commerce, education, and tourism.
art: Osman Hamdi Bey - The Turtle Trainer
